卐字的基本解释

卐
wàn
古代印度宗教的吉祥标志。显现金光，如来佛胸前有卐字。中国唐代武则天定音为“万”。义为“吉祥万德之所集”。佛经中又写作“卍”。

卐字的汉语字典释义

[①]［wàn］
［《翻譯名义集》音萬］
亦作“卐1”。
古印度宗教的吉祥标记。象火炎上升，梵文音室利靺蹉。佛教中以“卍”为佛陀“三十二相”之一。武则天时，定其读音为“万”。

卐字的康熙字典解释

卐字的起名意思

暂无。

Swastika
Basic explanation of words
Swastika
wàn
An auspicious symbol of ancient Indian religion. It shows cash light, and the Tathagata Buddha has a swastika on his chest. Wu Zetian in the Tang Dynasty of China defined it as "wan". Righteousness is "collection of auspicious virtues". "Swastika" is also written in the Buddhist scriptures.
Swastika
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［wàn］
["The Collection of Translation Names" Sound Wan]
Also known as "卐1".
An auspicious sign of ancient Indian religion. As the flames rise, the Sanskrit sound room is smashed. In Buddhism, "swastika" is one of the "32 phases" of the Buddha. In the time of Wu Zetian, he pronounced "10,000".
